WRITING.TEXT: Thanks. It looks great on GNOME [too!](http://i.imgur.com/QB7VRWT.jpg)
Definitely Ubuntu GNOME. Best looking DE, pretty fast and I love the keyboard focused workflow.
Nautilus is great. I dig the simple UI and it's nice to use too.
EU4 is kinda boring. Every game on the same map, no detailed graphics of provinces. It's just as playing a database and not a game.

I think that the trade screen would get the 'Trade tiles' option, when clicked you would be transferred to the map with the option to select tiles you would like from them (similar to city screen where you select which tiles you want to work on). You could only select the tiles adjacent to your border so they wouldn't get messy.
